result.execSummary:
The defendant Kiet Van Tran was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

With credit for 75 days.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kiet Van Tran

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Scanned:  Order to Produce signed on 12/30/2015.
Sworn as interpreter:  Rosine Schmitt.

Defendant Kiet Van Tran in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kiet Van Tran in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Parties reviewed report.  Parties do not challenge the report and stipulate to its' findings.  Court finds the defendant has been restored to competency.  

Defendant changes his plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 75 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.  Court WAIVED COSTS AND SURCHARGES.  Any mandatory surcharges are to be paid by March 8, 2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kiet Van Tran not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for review hearing.  Defense would like to proceed with a plea/sentencing hearing but the interpreter was not notified.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 21.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kiet Van Tran not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered Defendant committed for treatment.   Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) received and filed with court.
from OCRP, filed.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kiet Van Tran not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Based on letter received on 10/30/2015 from OCRP, Court rescinds the order from October 29, 2015.  The order dated October 8, 2015 is to stand and the defendant be evaluated at the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from OCRP requesting defendant be evaluated in the CJF, filed.
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) received and filed with court.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kiet Van Tran not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Based on letter received from OCRP, Court ordered the defendant to be evaluated on an inpatient basis at a facility designated by DHS.  Court ordered the sheriff to transport the defendant to the designated institute; order signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 24.  Review hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Letter from Outpatient Competency Restoration Program received and filed with court.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kiet Van Tran not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Report by Dr. Robert Rawski received and filed with court.
Order of commitment for Treatment (Incompetency) received, signed, and filed with court.
Sworn as interpreter:  Rosine Schmitt.

Defendant Kiet Van Tran in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kiet Van Tran in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties do not challenge the report.  Court adopts the findings of the report.  Court finds the defendant not competent to proceed but likely to regain competency within statutory period.  Court orders the proceedings suspended.  Court orders the defendant committed to DHS.  The defendant is referred to the Outpatient Competency Restoration Program for evaluation; order signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letter by Dr. Rawski received and filed with court.
Sworn as interpreter: Rosine Schmitt.

Defendant Kiet Van Tran in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kiet Van Tran in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Dr. Rawski was unable to examine the defendant because no interpreter was available.  Time limits tolled.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Vietnamese interpreter needed.

Defendant Kiet Van Tran in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Kiet Van Tran in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kiet Van Tran not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains set for Plea and Sentencing on 9/4/2015 at 8:30 am.

Filed:
*  Defendant's Motion for Modification of Bail.

Bail/bond hearing scheduled on August 28, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.
Rosine Schmitt appeared but was not needed.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, defendant Kiet Van Tran not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Matthew N or Co-Defendant Travis Schmitt

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Kiet Van Tran in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Kiet Van Tran in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Vu Nguyen
  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
